scenarioDescription:
The GJ 674 Exoplanetary System


Overview

GJ 674 is a star with 0.35 times the mass of the Sun, and NaN times its radius. It is located 14.84 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 0.55 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

GJ 674 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the GJ 674 system


GJ 674 b

GJ 674 b was discovered by the La Silla Observatory observatory, in 2007-10, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.04 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of GJ 674 b is 11.130 times the mass of Earth. The radius of GJ 674 b is 3.330 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, GJ 674 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanetary system GJ 674, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the La Silla Observatory.
name: GJ 674 - System With 1 Exoplanet
